Package com.advertisementproject.permissionservice.messagebroker.config

Class MessageBrokerConfig

java.lang.Object
com.advertisementproject.permissionservice.messagebroker.config.MessageBrokerConfig
@Configuration
public class MessageBrokerConfig
extends java.lang.Object
Configurations for RabbitMQ message broker including specifications for queues and exchanges to be used for cross microservice communication

  • Constructor Details

    • MessageBrokerConfig

      public MessageBrokerConfig()

  • Method Details

    • getObjectMapper

      @Bean public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper getObjectMapper()
      Custom object mapper bean for getting an object mapper that can handle time based variables like Instant
      Returns:
      a configured ObjectMapper

    • permissionAddQueue

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue permissionAddQueue()
      Queue configuration bean
      Returns:
      queue for direct messaging to be used when permissions should be added for a supplied user id

    • permissionDeleteQueue

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue permissionDeleteQueue()
      Queue configuration bean
      Returns:
      queue for receiving messages with a user id to know when a user's permissions should be deleted

    • userDeleteExchange

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.FanoutExchange userDeleteExchange()
      Fanout exchange configuration bean
      Returns:
      fanout exchange for messages informing that a user's information should be deleted, which can be received by multiple applications that connect to the exchange with a queue

    • userDeleteBinding

      @Bean public org.springframework.amqp.core.Binding userDeleteBinding()
      Queue to fanout exchange binding configuration bean
      Returns:
      binding between permissionsDeleteQueue and userDeleteExchange, which means that when a message is sent to "user.delete", a copy of that message will be sent to "permissionsUserDelete", which the application can listen for
